definition: to toll a bell
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
chiming clock

sentences.english: Bells were tolled all over the country at the King's death.
sentences.chinese: 全國爲國王之死而鳴鐘。

sentences.english: Awake, O bell! proclaim the hour.
Hardly had the bell struck the ten, the old man sat on the table in the sitting room.
sentences.chinese: 自鳴鐘敲了十下，老人已經穩穩的坐在客廳裏的桌前。

sentences.english: The chime clock ticks away on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 自鳴鐘在擱板上滴答滴答地響著。

sentences.english: The Scots like to ring in the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格蘭人喜歡鳴鐘迎新年。

sentences.english: All these things are sounding the bell for the earth changes.
sentences.chinese: 所有的一切都爲地球的改變而鳴鐘。

definition: bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to transmit an order
ceremony
silent prayer/pray in silence
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
fire and candles/household things that burn
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
fairyland/honorific: your homeland
folk customs
carriage
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
arsenal/store of arms
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
